title: Hotel Front Desk Agent
description:
**Company Background**

The Standard is one of the most culturally engaged hotels in the world. Hotels with real cultural life, an inclusive spirit and true creative attitude. A destination layered with events and amusements that leaves you with an uplifted feeling.

The Standard's irreverent and playful sensibility, combined with a careful consideration of design, detail and service, have established its reputation as a pioneer of hospitality, travel, dining, nightlife, and beyond. The Standard hotels are known for their taste-making clientele, their pioneering design, and their unrelenting un-Standard-ness.

**Mission Statement**

To create experience by embracing and empowering a diverse collective of team members, collaborators, and guests, who choose to call The Standard home.

**Our Purpose**

The Standard’s commitment is to being an anchor for each neighbourhood in which we reside as well as a platform for culture and creativity. Bringing people together in its spaces to interact with each other in genuine ways.

Our promise is to ensure that a stay is an experience and that a memory means making friends and having stories to tell. To understand why it exists, is to understand that The Standard, is a platform for people to meet, to engage, to learn, to dine, to sleep, to dance, to hideaway, to make believe and to do so whilst being yourself and having fun doing it.

We think of ourselves as a stage, not just a hotel. Here, you can become whomever you like, even if for just a night. Here, you will meet new friends, find new challenges, eat new food, stay up late, sleep in later, and at times, never even leave the property. We are unapologetically comfortable with disrupting expectations. **It’s WHO WE ARE!**

**#StandardFamily**

**Job Title Front Desk Agent**

**Job Purpose:** To warmly welcome and assist guests with exceptional service, ensuring seamless check-ins and check-outs, and providing valuable local insights to enhance their overall experience at The Standard.

**Work Area:**

Front Office

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

· Maintain complete knowledge of and comply with all departmental policies/service procedures/standards.

· Maintain complete knowledge of correct maintenance and use of equipment. Use equipment only as intended.

· Anticipate guests’ needs, respond promptly and acknowledge all guests, however busy and whatever time of day.

· Maintain positive guest relations at all times.

· Resolve guest complaints, ensuring guest satisfaction.

· Monitor and maintain cleanliness, sanitation and organization of assigned work areas.

· Maintain complete knowledge of:

o scheduled daily activities

o in-house groups

o beeper number/radios carried by hotel personnel

o all special requests (DND, screen calls, NRG, etc.)

o hours of operation of each outlet

o features and services provided by the hotel

· Access all functions of system.

· Accommodate all telephone and email requests in a congenial manner within minutes of request.

· Accept, record and deliver wake-up calls.

title: Bilingual Prevention Education Program Manager
description:
Who is Bridging Access to Care, Inc.: Bridging Access to Care, Inc. (BAC) is a nonprofit, multi-service, community-based behavioral health care organization committed to building healthy communities, one person at a time.

Brooklyn Aids Task Force was the very first HIV/AIDS organization in Brooklyn prioritizing serving persons living with HIV/AIDS (PLWHA) since 1986. In 2012, Brooklyn Aids Task Force changed its name to BAC and successfully made the transition from an AIDS-centered organization to a multi-service community-based healthcare organization. Today, BAC provides mental health and substance use-related social services, comprehensive HIV/AIDS care, and coordinated health care and supportive services to under-served racial and ethnic minority communities in the Brooklyn and other parts of New York City.

Bridging Access to Care, Inc. offers a competitive salary package, including health insurance, retirement plan, paid time off, and opportunities for professional development.

**JOB SUMMARY:** The Program Manager for Prevention Education will oversee the planning, implementation, and evaluation of programs and services. This role involves managing a team of program staff, ensuring compliance with funding requirements, tracking program performance, and fostering partnerships with community stakeholders. The Program Manager will play a crucial role in advancing the organization's mission, ensuring the delivery of high-quality services, and driving program growth and sustainability.

**EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS:** 

**MINIMUM:** Bachelor’s degree in teaching, psychology, social work or related fields.  
**MINIMUM:** 4 years of supervisory a team of 4 or more experience required.

MINIMUM: Two (2) years of Non-Profit Management/ Allocating funding Experience required

Bilingual English-speaking candidates are strongly encouraged to apply. (Spanish and Haitian-Creole preferred)

**LICENSURE:**  NYS Driver’s license preferred.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Supervision and Leadership**

* Supervise and provide weekly trauma-informed supervision to front-line health workers, including Health Educators, Care Specialists, Senior Counselors, Lead Navigators/Navigators, and other assigned staff.
* Provide weekly individual supervision and biweekly group supervision to staff and assigned interns.
* Responsible for the overall implementation and management of the OASAS contracts.
* Allocate nonprofit contracts, track, and report metrics to stakeholders, and ensure timely achievement of deliverables.
* Actively participate in the recruitment, onboarding, training, and performance management of supervised positions.
* Educate staff on data collection, documentation, and reporting protocols.
* Perform daily chart reviews and periodic group observations to ensure quality service delivery.
* Utilize weekly electronic health record reports to measure program deliverables, ensure data accuracy, and provide constructive feedback.
* Supervise outreach, street outreach, and groups.
* Review, develop, and implement departmental policies and procedures.

**Assessments and Patient Data Collection**

* Ensure that all client assessments and service plans are thorough, client-centered, and completed on time.
* Conduct and supervise intakes, assessments, and treatment plans. Assign cases and tasks as needed.
* Supervise program staff and complete all required monthly and other reports.
* Ensure all services are provided in a culturally and linguistically appropriate manner.
* Lead the collection of post-program patient data and surveys.

**Program Coordination and Outreach**

* Participate in department and program meetings, including Weekly Team Meetings, Monthly Tenant Meetings, etc.
* Effectively use tools such as safety plans, community meetings, psycho-education groups, team meetings, red flag reviews, treatment planning conferences, and self-care to create a nonviolent and trauma-sensitive culture.
* Allocate up to 25% of your role to participating in outreach efforts.
* Work with the Marketing and Communications Team to develop targeted messages that increase client engagement and promote activities and events.

**Other Responsibilities**

* Other duties as assigned based on program needs.
* Duties may be outside regular work hours and may include evenings and weekends when needed.
* May serve as a backup driver for the agency mobile unit.

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES:**

* Expertise in Evidence-Based Interventions and Practices, such as Motivational Interviewing and Strengthening Families.
* Ability to identify system performance measures and implement strategies to enhance staff engagement and performance.
* Strong proficiency in using electronic health record (EHR) systems, with project management, problem-solving, and analytical skills.
* Independently handles responsibilities within the prevention field, utilizing deep knowledge of sexual risk and trauma impacts on diverse communities.
* Skilled in working with culturally diverse populations and willing to work flexible hours as required.

title: Painting Estimator – Sales Manager
description:
**Painting Estimator – Sales Manager**

**Full Time: Mon-Fri**

Essex County, NJ

Established in 2011, **That 1 Painter** is the fastest growing painting company in the nation offering a wide range of 18 different service options. Our unwavering commitment to exceptional workmanship ensures the highest quality outcomes, creating not just stunning results but also great satisfaction. Our Brand Promise is to be The Best House Guest Ever. If you possess a passion for delivering unparalleled customer service and desire to be part of a company with a remarkable culture, we look forward to meeting you!

This is an exceptional, diverse opportunity for you to estimate and manage jobs and be ultimately responsible for every lead, customer, and project assigned. You will achieve revenue targets of the location, maintain consistent profitably, and achieve an excellent reputation within your territory.

**Benefits:**

* Holiday Pay
* Great Company and Culture!
* Company Truck Provided
* Amazing Customers
* 4K base draw
* 5.5% - 10% commission range on completed projects
* Uncapped commission potential based on individual performance
* Comprehensive benefits package including health insurance and paid time off
* Two weeks’ vacation (ten days) after a six-month waiting period
* Bonus opportunities

**In this role, you will:**

* Recruit and manage subcontractors.
* Estimate on-site with potential customers.
* Estimate virtually with potential clients as needed.
* Accurately estimate labor and materials on the quote and submit the quote to the customer within 24 hours.
* Follow up with all quotes seven times within six months or until approved/rejected.
* Schedule approved estimates in accordance with GM guidance.
* Collect deposits before the start of each job.
* Upsell clients on additional services.
* Communicate with customers concerning color and other basic preparations before the job starts.
* Ensure jobs are appropriately staffed and materials.
* Communicate with Project Managers as needed after the job starts.
* Attend and contribute at all staff meetings.
* Pursue strategic relationships on behalf of That 1 Painter (realtors, property managers, etc.).
* Ensure projects are kept on schedule and within budget while meeting client's needs and delivering a quality project.
* Help problem-solve with crew leads if problems arise on any project.
* Generate schedules and plans of operation for painting projects.
* Identify potential issues and ensure timely decisions are made.
* Pursue strategic relationships on behalf of That 1 Painter (realtors, property managers, roofers, etc.).

**We Require:**

* **Two (2) years’ experience in Sales or Project Management**
* **Valid Driver’s License**
* Experience with estimating & customer service
* Strong Sales Acumen
* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, managers, subcontractors, and clients
* Ability to learn and work independently in a fast-paced environment; self-motivated
* Superb time management, prioritization, and organization skills
* Detail-oriented, dependable, and reliable
* Ability to accurately estimate product and labor costs
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
* Proficiency in using a personal computer, cell phone, and software programs

**Ability to commute/relocate:**

Essex County, NJ and Surrounding Area: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

**Check us out online at That1painter.com!**

title: Dietitian
description:
**Why RVNAhealth?**  

RVNAhealth (formerly known as RVNA, the Ridgefield Visiting Nurse Association) is a twelve-time winner of the Hearst Media Top Workplaces Award. We offer rewarding career opportunities where you can make an enormous impact*.*
  

  

**Benefits of Working at RVNAhealth**  

RVNAhealth is committed to providing an exceptional, supportive, and progressive work environment for each employee. We offer:  

* Competitive compensation
* Extensive benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, a 403(b) plan with matching contributions, life and disability insurance plans
* Paid time off
* Personal Wellness Days
* A supportive and employee-centric culture
* Comprehensive orientation
* Career path
* Ongoing educational, training and certification opportunities
* Wellness programs
* Work-life balance: full-time, part-time, and per-diem opportunities

The RVNAhealth Dietitian plays a critical role in consulting with clients and patients to address their unique nutritional needs and developing specialized diets for optimal health. This position also supports the agency by presenting educational programs, collaborating with marketing for events and speaking engagements, and assisting agency clinicians in patient care as needed.  

  

**Responsibilities:**  

  

**Community Engagement**  

o Prepare for, attend, and actively participate in health and wellness events, offering services such as nutrition screening and mini-counseling.  

o Develop nutrition programs and presentations for community events.  

  

**Content Development**  

o Develop nutrition-related articles for Agency print and electronic publications and the website.  

o Develop and customize educational and communication materials (e.g., forms, recipes) for clinical and community nutrition services.  

  

* **Client Care/Clinical Responsibilities:**


o Perform comprehensive nutrition assessments for home health and hospice with follow-up as needed, including:  

o Schedule, perform, prepare for, document, and bill for self-pay nutrition education and counseling services for individuals and groups.  

  

**Collaboration and Support**  

o Collaborate with marketing and development departments to build business and promote the agency.  

o Support the agency at fundraising events, receptions, and other community partnership activities.  

  

**Quality Improvement**  

o Participate in the agency's quality improvement process, including attending mandatory staff meetings.  

o Provide constructive feedback to improve agency performance.  

  

 **Professional Conduct**  

o Demonstrate punctuality and good attendance in accordance with HR policies.  

o Establish positive, respectful relationships with employees, volunteers, and the community.  

o Demonstrate computer literacy by effectively using electronic communication and entering information into agency systems accurately and timely.  

  

**Qualifications:**  

* Currently licensed as a Registered Dietitian in the state of CT.
* Demonstrated computer literacy, with the ability to problem solve.
* Ability to teach others through the use of visual, auditory and kinesthetic methods.
* Strong organizational skills with attention to detail.
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently on projects.
* Is self-directed and able to move from priority to priority independently.

  

***RVNAhealth is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. RVNAhealth is committed to building a workplace where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized.***  

  

*This agency is independently owned and operated. Your application will go directly to the agency, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this agency. All inquiries about employment at this agency should be made directly to the agency location and not to the Connecticut Association for Healthcare at Home.*

title: Linear Associate Account Manager
description:
Disney’s Linear Ad Operations team is seeking a Linear Ad Operations Associate, who will be an exceptional addition to our Disney Advertising Sales Operations team on one or more of our exciting brands. These brands are composed of The Walt Disney Company’s (NYSE: DIS) global entertainment and news television properties, owned television stations, as well as radio and publishing businesses. This includes the ABC Television Network, ABC Owned Television Stations Group, ABC Studios, ESPN, Hulu, Disney Channels Worldwide, Freeform, FX and National Geographic as well as Disney/ABC Domestic Television and Disney Media Distribution. Linear Ad Operations leads the operational function for the Disney Ad Sales team. The Ad Operations team focuses on the functions of account management, trafficking, scheduling and sponsorship business for all Disney networks. We are committed to providing a high level of client service to our internal and external clients. We are looking for people who are excited to contribute to a high-performing team.

**Job Summary:**


In this role, you will report into the Manager of Linear Ad Operations and will work closely with the Ad Operations team members and sales teams. The Linear Associate Account Manager position will be responsible to lead and manage television Ad Sales accounts from booking to invoicing. This role takes a leadership position within the sales team to provide insight on advertiser behavior from both the buying and trafficking side of the agency. The right person for this role is meticulous and thrives in a dynamic and fast-paced collaborative environment, wants an opportunity to make a significant impact and jumps at the opportunity to tackle new challenges!


If you are someone who meets this description, then this is a great role for you.

**Responsibilities and Duties of the Role:**

* Leads all deal account management and maintenance for all their assigned advertisers. This includes day-to-day point of contact for ad agencies and sales teams, booking commercial inventory, implementing agency requests and changes for their ad schedules, and ensures accuracy with deal points and traffic instructions.
* Provide ongoing feedback for improved efficiencies.
* Ensure deal dollars are booked and consistent to what the advertiser purchased.
* Resolves invoice discrepancies to further our network collection target of 75-day DSO (improves company cash flow).
* Work with Accounting to execute pricing adjustments and other invoice adjustments as needed.
* Work with the traffic team as needed to ensure booked inventory corresponds to the traffic instructions received, escalating with the buying agency and sales when required. Ensure that agency positioning and programming needs are met.
* Responds to evolving business needs, and tasks/projects set forth by management.
* Maintain and develop strong working relationships with buying agencies, creative agencies, traffic agencies and internal departments supporting Customer Marketing and Sales.
* Adhere to all department’s Service Level Agreements.

**Required Education,** **Experience/Skills/Training:**


Required

* BA/BS or equivalent work experience
* 1+ year of experience in a related industry preferred


Preferred

* Can operate within the context of highly defined, routine processes and procedures adhering to organizational deadlines
* Proven leadership & problem-solving skills
* Has knowledge of Disney’s multimedia properties
* Enjoys working as part of a team
* Proven leadership & problem-solving skills
* Has experience and enjoys both working independently and collaboratively with a team
* Interested in working in a fast paced, team environment


#DisneyAdvertising

  

The hiring range for this position in New York is $65,000 - $81,100 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

title: Coordinator, Sports Brand Solutions
description:
The Sports Brand Solutions group is a team of experts that provide creative marketing sponsorship and integration opportunities across ESPN’s vast content portfolio. The team is responsible for the sponsorship process including, but not limited to, strategy, ideation, and execution.


The primary function of the team is to generate and maximize revenue across our robust multimedia programming, working closely with Disney Ad Sales, ESPN Production/Programming, and Advertisers.

**Job Summary:**


We have 3 open roles.

* One Coordinator, Sports Brand Solutions, will be responsible for supporting our sponsorship business specifically for women’s sports properties including College Basketball, WNBA, NWSL, espnW, and more.
* One Coordinator, Sports Brand Solutions, will be responsible for supporting our sponsorship business specifically for key properties such as SportsCenter, Get Up, First Take, Pardon the Interruption, Around the Horn, and The Pat McAfee Show.
* One Coordinator, Sports Brand Solutions, will be responsible for supporting our sponsorship business specifically for key properties such as ESPYS, NHL, F1, UFC/Boxing, Tennis, and select special initiatives.


The primary role will be to work with various internal teams to schedule and book on-air and digital/social sponsorships for **all** programming related to assigned properties. This includes but is not limited to Live Event Programming, Studio Shows, and Digital/Social Handles.


The Coordinator will play a key role in creating and maintaining grids for each property to ensure proper allocation for each program and all digital/social sponsorship.


Ultimately, the responsibilities will be to keep order and process across all sponsorship efforts, streamlining all areas of the business from pitch through execution.

**Responsibilities and Duties of the Role:**

* Post Sale
	+ Book features within Disney Ad Sales/ESPN systems (managing the process directly with the sales teams and their clients)
		- Communicate with TV Ad Ops any schedule changes and updates
	+ Manage Sponsorship tracking grids for the SBS team to maintain a clear perspective on integration availability and potential content overlaps to consider in given windows that impact production and sales conversations
	+ View and clip integrations to confirm accuracy, share with sales teams, and elevate any issues
	+ Assist Manager in the creation, delivery, and maintenance of sponsored graphics and studio requests
* Sales Materials
	+ Assist in developing sales opportunities for assigned properties
		- Assist with digital and social product creation
		- Assist with multimedia pricing requests
* Support the ideation process for new opportunities
	+ Upload/Update materials across Cantina, Sharepoint and SalesHub
	+ Communicate opportunities to Sales utilizing organization-wide processes
* Streamline Communication and Transparency
	+ Manage status reports, meeting recap notes, etc.
	+ Assist with the upkeep and distribution of weekly obligations across the sport vertical (includes ESPN production, programming, comms, ops, etc.)

**Required Education, Experience/Skills/Training:**

* Bachelor’s Degree
* Proficient in Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, GoogleDocs
* Minimum 1 year of experience required, marketing or sponsorship experience preferred
* Highly organized, time management skills, ability to multi-task
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Team player with the desire to do whatever it takes
* Willingness to work flexible hours and/or occasional travel


#DisneyAdvertising

  


The hiring range for this position in New York, NY is $53,600- $73,700 and in Santa Monica, CA is $52,400- $70,200 per year based on a 40 hour work week. The amount of hours scheduled per week may vary based on business needs. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

title: Residential Maintenance Manager - East New York, Brooklyn
description:
A fast-growing residential property management company is looking for a hands-on **Maintenance Manager** for a scattered site portfolio in **East New York (470 units)**, Brooklyn.

The Maintenance Manager will be responsible for the day-to day operations of the portfolio and oversight of the maintenance team. The skills required for this position entail but are not limited to common area and apartment repairs in the scope of plumbing, electrical, HVAC, carpentry, painting and appliances. Further oversight of the building’s curb appeal through building exterior inspections, cleaning and grounds maintenance is required.

**Responsibilities** include, but are not limited to:

* Inspect buildings regularly and develop a preventative maintenance routine.
* Supervise and lead team’s response to residents’ maintenance requests in a timely manner.
* Coordinate compliance with city agencies (DOB, DEP, DHCR, DOH, HPD) to respond to violations.
* Ensure vacant apartments are made move-in ready in a timely manner.
* Maintain an inventory of supplies and tools sufficient for providing the appropriate level of service; assure that all orders are approved by property management before being placed.
* Ensure safety standards including environmental procedures, lockout/tagout, mold awareness programs, safe work practices, and emergency response procedures are maintained.
* Supervise contractors making sure they practice good workmanship.
* Perform and/or oversee the inspections of resident’s units such as move-ins, move-outs, or annuals.
* Ensure service contractors visit the building monthly for appropriate maintenance (pest control, elevator, gas boiler, etc.).
* Handle emergency calls during non-business hours when applicable.

**Qualifications:**

* High School Diploma or equivalent.
* 5 years of minimum experience in residential/commercial supervision.
* Valid EPA Lead-Safe certification a plus.
* Must have technical understanding of all building equipment, fire systems, and mechanical systems.
* General computer skills for composing and reading e-mails to and from management and contractors, utilizing the building’s management software and purchasing supplies on the internet.
* Organized self-starter with excellent attention to detail.
* Good leadership skills and strong work ethic.
* Prior experience working with a professional real estate management company.

Base: $75-$85K

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

* Brooklyn, NY 11208: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Bilingual Mobile Substance Use Counselor - OASAS
description:
***Who is Bridging Access to Care, Inc.:*** *Bridging Access to Care, Inc. (BAC) is a nonprofit, multi-service, community-based behavioral health care organization committed to building healthy communities, one person at a time.*

*In 2012, Brooklyn Aids Task Force changed its name to BAC and successfully made the transition from an AIDS-centered organization to a multi-service community-based healthcare organization. Brooklyn Aids Task Force was the very first HIV/AIDS organization in Brooklyn prioritizing serving persons living with HIV/AIDS (PLWHA) since 1986. Today, BAC provides mental health and substance use-related social services, comprehensive HIV/AIDS care, and coordinated health care and supportive services to under-served racial and ethnic minority communities in the Brooklyn and other parts of New York City.*

*Bridging Access to Care, Inc. offers* a competitive salary package, including health insurance, retirement plan, paid time off, and opportunities for professional development.

**Job Summary:**

BAC is looking for a motivated **Bilingual** **Mobile Substance Use Counselor** willing to join our team. The bilingual Mobile Substance Use Counselor will be responsible for but not limited to doing individual outreach and meeting client in the community and our sites. They will conduct screenings, assessments and individual services to people utilizing substances. The bilingual Mobile Substance Use Counselor will refer clients to programs they may need as well as building relationships with them and the community.

**Education and Work Qualifications:**

Minimum: Masters Degree in Social Work or related field.

Minimum one (1) year with target population, (i.e., Substance Use, AIDS/ HIV, and Mental Health)

Minimum one (1) year experience/training in integrated mental health and substance abuse assessment/treatment, Motivational Interviewing techniques.

**Bilingual/Second Language:** English speaking Haitian Creole and/or Spanish (Strongly preferred)

**DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

**Outreach & Coordination**

* Conduct outreach via the mobile truck throughout Brooklyn, targeting individuals who utilize substances.
* Coordinate services with community-based organizations across Brooklyn.
* Develop and maintain relationships with alcohol and substance use detoxification, rehabilitation, and treatment centers.

**Assessment & Counseling**

* Conduct or review assessments to determine the substance abuse needs and preferences of clients.
* Provide individual counseling that addresses substance use issues.
* Utilize Harm Reduction, Trauma-Informed Care, Motivational Interviewing, and other Evidence-Based Practices.
* Guide the use of onsite drug testing for residents with relevant service plan goals.

**Crisis Intervention & Emergency Response**

* Execute emergency plans as outlined in the policy and procedure manual.
* Administer CPR, first aid, or Naloxone as needed, and provide crisis intervention.
* Promote a smoke-free environment.

**Collaboration & Compliance**

* Collaborate with peer counselors, medical staff, and client support representatives to deliver integrated services.
* Maintain up-to-date, accurate individual paper and electronic case records.
* Report serious incidents, allegations of abuse, and other sensitive situations, completing incident reports as per agency policy.
* Comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and agency policies, fostering an ethical organizational culture.

**Professional Development & Participation**

* Attend clinical meetings, staff meetings, and supervision sessions.
* Participate in in-service training and professional development activities.
* Obtain and maintain CPR and First Aid certifications.
* Participate in management and supervision meetings.

**General Duties**

* Comply with attendance and timekeeping rules, reliably reporting to work on an ongoing basis.
* May have on-call responsibilities.
* Perform other job-related duties as assigned.

**SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, and ABILITIES REQUIRED:** 

· Proficiency in Microsoft Word

· Flexible, Ability to meet deadlines.

· Use of Motivational Interviewing techniques/stage wise treatment and Integrated Dual Disorder Treatment (IDDT)

· WRAP Knowledge of Harm Reduction

· Ability to prioritize, follow policy and procedures***.*** 

· ***Ability to deliver Trauma informed, Client Centered Treatment***

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 403(b)
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Addiction Medicine
* Public Health

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

* Addiction counseling: 1 year (Preferred)
* work within a Trauma informed Framework: 1 year (Preferred)
* work within Harm Reduction Framework: 1 year (Preferred)
* conduct outreach: 1 year (Preferred)

Language:

* English and Haitian Creole fluently (Preferred)
* English and Spanish fluently (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* CASAC/ CASAC-T (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Brooklyn, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 100% (Preferred)

title: Field Service Technician
description:
**Job Overview**

NuEnergen, LLC is looking for a full-time Field Service Technician with electrical installation (hardware/software) experience who can help assemble, install and service NuEnergen’s real time meter panels, which contain off-the-shelf components and measure utility consumption via monitoring low voltage pulses from utility meters (electricity, gas, steam). In this role you will service, maintain, repair, adjust, test and install NuEnergen, LLC built Real-Time meters. This is a customer facing position and requires strong communication skills along with a commitment to service excellence. The successful candidate will also assist in surveying sites for potential demand response opportunities.

We are looking for highly a motivated individual willing to perform with high standards of safety, productivity, quality, and customer satisfaction. Must be able to work in various field conditions to complete the work throughout the New York metropolitan area and willing to reach client locations via mass transit where possible.

This role will report to our Director of Operations. NuEnergen is headquartered in White Plains, NY and the ideal candidate should live within a 45 to 60-minute commute to the office and be ready for frequent travel in and around NYC.

**Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for surveying client facilities for requirements needed to install NuEnergen real time meters and submitting detailed survey reports
* Assemble NuEnergen Real Time Meter panels from off-the-shelf components and configure software to enable meter functionality
* Advise and train customers concerning equipment operation and maintenance;
* Troubleshoot faulty Real Time Meters, diagnosing basic issues with individual RTM components, utility equipment, etc.
* Work with utility personnel to diagnose issues with utility equipment.
* Communicate with clients to troubleshoot open service issues and provide technical support;
* Must accurately collect customer data, document the installations in writing, maintain records in our tracking system, and follow detailed procedures.
* Escalate open issues to management.

**Desired Skills & Experience:**

* Prior Field Support/Field Technician experience highly desirable
* Prior mechanical or electronic assembly for Automated Meter Infrastructure (AMI) knowledge is a major plus.
* Understand basic wiring to connect Real Time Meters to utility demarcation boxes to collect low voltage pulses
* Understanding basic networking to enable connectivity of RTM via cellular or client-based LAN connections
* Must be comfortable with navigating through all 5 boroughs using mass transit
* Must be dependable, detail-oriented, have good verbal skills and a neat/clean appearance;
* Must be comfortable interacting with customers and uphold NuEnergen, LLC standards;
* Must have the ability to use assigned tools properly and work within safety guidelines.
* All must be performed while maintaining and presenting a professional and customer friendly interaction with all customers.
* H.S. Diploma Required, Associates degree or Bachelor’s degree preferred
* Experience will be considered in lieu of degree

**Compensation Package includes:**

(1) Base Pay of $55,000-$70,000/year (depending on experience) paid on a monthly basis.

(2) 401K plan (company match up to 4% of your base pay).

(3) Company profit sharing plan paid at year end (target is 10% of base pay).

(4) 15 combined PTO and sick leave days per year plus Flex-time.

(5) Medical benefits (50% of employee's portion paid by company).

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Data Entry Specialist
description:
**Who We Are**

Nationwide Coils is a leading commercial HVAC manufacturer and supplier of custom and OEM replacement coils. Headquartered in Westchester, NY, with branches across the U.S. and growing, we support businesses and industries large and small, including mechanical contractors, engineers, state facilities, government organizations, and many more.

We pride ourselves on a right first-time approach, quality U.S.-made products, and excellent customer service.

**About this Role**

Nationwide Coils is implementing a new role at our headquarters in Somers, NY. The role as Data Entry Specialist will beessential to our business organization and growth. This is an in-office, full-time position with 40 hours of work per week.

Data entry responsibilities will include but not be limited to:

* Invoicing payable and receivables on a daily basis
* Reviewing credit applications and contact trade references
* Comparing data to source documents for accuracy
* Efficiently compile, sort and organize data
* Performing related tasks, such as ordering office supplies, filing documents and providing administrative support

**Qualifications/Skills**

* Background in Accounting or equivalent job experience with data entry
* Fluent in QuickBooks Desktop and Microsoft Office
* Knowledge of general accounting practices, including the processes of payables and receivables
* Positive, honest, and highly reliable with proven ability to maintain confidentiality
* Inventive with ideas on how to work most efficiently
* Ability to prioritize and multi-task in a fast-paced work environment
* Highly organized and detail oriented
* Able to complete tasks accurately and timely
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Thrives as a team player in a collaborative office environment
* Ability to interface well with staff and external contacts in a professional manner

**WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN THE NATIONWIDE COILS TEAM?** 

The same reasons our other team members have — many who have been with us from our inception over 20 years ago!

We are a close-knit bunch who keep a friendly, casual, yet professional environment. Although we are serious about business, we don’t always take ourselves too seriously. We take pride in our work, our dedicated team and understand the value each employee brings to the success of our business. At Nationwide Coils, you will not be a cog in a wheel or another fish in the sea. As part of our team, we are pleased to offer the below benefits…

* Competitive salary
* Annual discretionary bonus
* PTO – 17 days paid time off per year (includes vacation, sick days, and personal days); paid holidays
* 401(k) eligibility after 6 months of employment with Safe Harbor Match
* Medical, dental and vision plan options
* Career growth and advancement opportunities within the organization about the Nationwide Coils team.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $25.00 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

description:
**Position Description Summary:**



The Host is responsible for daily execution of the Mission Statement, which includes providing First Class Service to both internal and external customers. The Host/Hostess is also responsible for the receiving and seating of guests and performing a variety of other tasks within a restaurant establishment which may include ringing up orders, refilling beverages, setting tables, and cleaning eating/serving areas.


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Exceed First Class Service standards and behavior with every guest, business partner and peers.
* Greets every guest with a friendly smile and positive attitude.
* Maintains consistent attention to the entrance of the restaurant and welcomes all guests with a smile and appropriate greeting following the company's customer service standards.
* Responds appropriately to guest concerns.
* Bussing tables, taking carryout orders and restocking the display case.
* Maintain and use seating chart for rotation of stations
* Records guests seating times in a consistent manner providing the highest quality of service.
* Seats guests and presents the menu
* Communicates with the wait staff and other restaurant personnel to ensure a guests' positive experience.
* Performs the tasks of the cashier and/or bus person as required including cashing out guests.
* Answer phones and guest’s questions.
* Maintain clean organized work environment that is free of safety hazards; May include sweeping and mopping.
* Accountable for compliance with all local, state, federal laws and regulation including those relating to food safety.
* Other duties as assigned.


**Position Qualifications:**


* High School diploma or GED
* Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities
* Ability to communicate clearly and concisely with Team Members, Managers, and Guests.
* Possess basic math skills and have the ability to handle money and a point of sale system
* Ability to work independently as well as with other team members
* Able to work unsupervised for extensive periods, and to demonstrate good judgment when dealing with guest
* Ability to work various shifts in a 7/365 team-oriented environment
* Excellent customer service skills and an ability to communicate effectively
* Self-starter able to prioritize and handle various tasks simultaneously
* Ability to adapt to changing priorities and unexpected situations
* Ability to lift a minimum of 25 lbs, perform essential job functions such as standing, bending, reaching, climbing on ladder, and walking long distances.
* Standing for long periods of time and the ability to work in environment with varying temperatures.

Required* 1 year(s): Customer Service/Restaurant Experience

Required* Entrepreneurial Spirit: Inspired to perform well by an ability to drive new ventures within the business

title: Fleet Maintenance Technician
description:
Job Summary:  
We are seeking a skilled Maintenance Technician to oversee the maintenance operations at our facility. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of all machinery and equipment.

**Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Supervise the labor hours, daily work and safety of associates engaged in fleet maintenance and repair within budget.
* Supervise parts inventory and consumable supplies within budget. Assist in monitoring work schedules including extra work days and shifts as needed.
* Coordinates required processes and repairs with proper departments as necessary.
* Executes the proper scheduling of fleet maintenance and repairs; along with compliance of all company programs, including preventive maintenance and inspection of vehicles, non-scheduled maintenance and troubleshooting, repair, rebuild and overhaul of all fleet vehicles.
* Assist in fleet maintenance functions and various operational and expense reporting. Suggests efficiency ideas, cost reduction measures and assists with the implementation of changes within fleet maintenance.
* Conducts audits daily to ensure all required documentation is accurately completed (including all work orders, breakdowns, preventive maintenance logs, pre/post trip inspections, certifications) and that items are installed correctly with a minimum potential for loss.
* Follows the fleet services budget and expenses for parts, tools and office supplies.
* Stays current with technical manuals, literature and technical advancements of the trade as it pertains to company owned vehicles.
* Builds and maintains associate relations through regular department or pre-shift meetings; maintains on-going interaction; keeps open communication channels with associates by answering questions and explaining policies and procedures; monitors associate morale; submits and responds to ideas to improve associate engagement and enablement.
* Responsible for housekeeping, clean up of all maintenance areas/work areas on a daily basis.
* Maintains all tools and equipment in clean, safe, working order
* Responds to emergency situations to ensure associate and facility safety

**Qualifications:**

* High School diploma or general education degree (GED);
* Medium / Heavy Duty truck technical training (2 years) preferred
* 5 years of experience in fleet maintenance and repair
* 1 to 2 years supervisory experience in fleet maintenance; or equivalent combination of education and related experience

**CERTIFICATIONS AND/OR TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:**

* Must possess a valid state Driver’s License meeting Company standards. Class A CDL preferred
* Annual Inspector Certification Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
* Brake Inspector Certification Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
* Knowledge of all tools necessary to perform all maintenance repair and diagnostics. Provide own hand tools necessary to perform all maintenance repair and diagnostics

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS**

* While performing the duties of this job, the associate is regularly required to stand, walk, use hands to handle or feel, reach with hands and arms, talk and hear.
* The associate is frequently required to climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, bend or crawl.
* The associate is occasionally required to sit and must frequently lift and/or move up to 100lbs.
* The associate is Repair work requires excellent hand and finger dexterity used for wrenches, hand tools and other shop equipment.
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

**Experience**:

* Truck Repair: 5 years (Preferred)
* Fleet Maintenance: 5 years (Preferred)
* Fleet management: 5 years (Preferred)

**Call or Text: (908) 514-9972**

title: Residential Accounts Receivable Specialist
description:
**Residential Accounts Receivable Specialist** 

Genuine Property Services is seeking an Accounts Receivable Specialist to join our Property Management team. They must have sound financial experience and be well versed in credit and collections best practices, while conducting all activities with excellent customer service. The Accounts Receivable Specialist will help manage internal controls to assure accuracy, completeness, validity, and other Accounts Receivable obligations. The successful candidate will bring a customer service mindset, and hands on approach. **Extensive experience with Yardi is required**.

**Responsibilities**

* Ensure accurate posting of rent payments and balances in Yardi.
* Post tenant ledger adjustments as needed and approved by General Manager and Senior Accountant.
* Reconcile bank accounts and security deposits monthly.
* Process move-outs with completed move-out forms provided by property management.
* Monitor and enter lease renewals.
* Run and distribute AR delinquency reports monthly or as requested by upper management.
* Track and report all monthly Section 8 and other subsidy payment suspensions.
* Inform electric sub- metering organization of occupancy changes.
* Assist residents with any ledger related issues.
* Provide information to landlord/tenant attorneys.
* Coordinate with community and resident managers regarding apartment repairs mandated by subsidy payers, court stipulation and monitor repair status and due dates.
* Assist with year-end audit preparation and final audit work for AR balances.
* Perform additional duties as assigned by Senior Accountant and senior management.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree, preferably in accounting/finance

title: Experienced Potty Training Teacher
description:
We seek a passionate, dedicated, Experienced Potty Training Teacher to join our team.
  

  

At The Learning Experience, you can have the opportunity to create a positive and engaging learning environment for children, where "*happy happens here*" is not just a motto but a way of life.  

  

We are looking for someone committed to helping children learn, play, grow, and thrive and providing the tools they need to succeed academically and emotionally.  

If you are a caring and creative individual passionate about working with preschool children, we encourage you to apply for this exciting Lead Preschool Teacher opportunity.  

  

**What We Offer:**  

  

* State-of-the-Art Classrooms: Our immersive classroom setting utilizes the latest technology, materials, and resources to allow children to "learn, play, and grow.”
* Opportunities for Growth: We offer ongoing training and professional development, tuition reimbursement, and leadership pathways to help you meet your goals as an educator.

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
**Human Resources Manager**

**Pfister Energy, Inc.** is a renewable energy company providing innovative power solutions and energy efficiency measures for commercial, industrial, and institutional facilities. We are a national developer and EPC of turnkey renewable energy, energy efficiency, and on-site distributed power generation systems, with over 600 megawatts (MW) of solar electric power (PV) installed in the United States. Pfister Energy provides in-house project development, engineering, pre-construction, project management, installation, system commissioning, and operations/maintenance.

**About the role**

As the **Human Resources Manager**, you will play a critical role in overseeing all aspects of HR operations within our company. You will be responsible for ensuring legal compliance, managing recruitment and onboarding, overseeing employee relations, administering benefits, and supporting HR strategy and development.

**Job Responsibilities**

**HR Policy and Compliance**

* Develop and implement HR policies and procedures to ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
* Maintain legal compliance throughout human resource management.
* Update and maintain employee handbooks for office and field employees to ensure policies are current and aligned with legal requirements.
* Effectively communicate policy updates to all employees.

**Recruitment and Onboarding**

* Maintain job postings for open positions.
* Providing initial screening of candidates and forward resumes to hiring managers.
* Schedule interviews as needed with prospective candidates.
* Preparing offer letters, review them with hiring managers, and sending them to candidates.
* Provide benefits information to candidates during the offer process.
* Own the onboarding process, ensuring all necessary documents are completed and returned, and making sure that all relevant parties are informed for setup purposes.

**Employee Relations and Performance Management**

* Oversee employee relations, including conflict resolution, performance management, and disciplinary actions.
* Provide guidance and support to employees and managers on HR-related matters.
* Collaborate with managers to address and resolve employee issues, ensuring a cohesive and supportive work environment.

**Benefits Administration and Immigration**

* Administer employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other employee perks.
* Ensure all employee information is current and accurate within the benefits portal.
* Manage the H1B and Green Card process, including communication with attorneys and ensuring all documentation is completed accurately and timely.
* Handle all unemployment and workers' compensation claims.

**Attendance and Leave Management**

* Track and manage employee attendance, PTO, and work-from-home days.
* Ensure compliance with company policies regarding attendance and leaves of absence.

**HR Strategy and Development**

* Collaborate with senior management to develop and implement HR strategies that support organizational objectives.
* Stay up-to-date on HR trends and best practices to ensure the company remains competitive in attracting and retaining top talent.

**HR Systems and Records Management**

* Implement the HR software and maintain accurate HR records.

**Qualifications and Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Psychology, or a related field.
* 5-7 years of HR experience, 3-5 years in a Management preferred.
* Strong knowledge of HR laws, regulations, and best practices.
* Experience in Construction or Renewable Energy is a strong plus.
* Proficient in HR Software and Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Detail-oriented and capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work collaboratively.
* Strong organizational and time-management skills.

**Work Location**: Onsite in Hawthorne, NJ

**Reporting To**: President

Pfister Energy is committed to creating a diverse environment and is an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Entry Level Sales Representative
description:
**About us**

New Jersey's most trusted remodeling company, Exterior Point has a primary focus on employee success and accomplishment. We have a strong company culture that promotes from within and aims to ensure job satisfaction.

**Who We Are:**

Exterior Point is one of the fastest growing home renovation companies in the country. Our dedication to quality and customer satisfaction has led to the expansion of our marketing department and we are seeking motivated individuals to join us in our continued success.

We have industry-leading, interactive training that will guarantee your success in this position. No prior construction or sales experience is required.

As a Field Marketer, you will play a crucial role in assessing needs and delivering value to our potential customers in New Jersey. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a growing company and make a significant impact in our marketing efforts.

**The Role:**

In your role as a Field Marketing & Lead Generation Specialist, your primary responsibility will be to support our sales team by connecting and engaging with potential prospects. With our strong training programs designed by industry experts, you'll develop the skills and tools necessary to excel in this position. This role provides valuable experience in marketing as well as comparable experience from working directly with the sales department. You will be the tip of the spear in the development of the department and individual growth.

**Role Responsibilities:**

* **Engage Potential Customers:** Utilize your communication skills to connect with potential customers and provide them with valuable information about our services.
* **Provide Value:** Serve as the initial point of contact between customers and our company - use knowledge and expertise to schedule appointments for inspections and estimates.
* **Brand Representative:** Uphold our company's standards of professionalism and excellence in every interaction, ensuring a positive experience for customers.

**Expectations:**

At Exterior Point, we value qualities and traits that go beyond technical skills. While previous experience in marketing or sales is not required for this entry-level position, we do expect candidates to embody the following attributes:

Prior experience in a similar field would be preferred but not required.

* **Professionalism:** Represent our company with professionalism and integrity in all interactions with customers and team members.
* **Positive Attitude:** Approach each task with enthusiasm and a positive attitude, even in challenging situations.
* **Strong Work Ethic:** Demonstrate a strong work ethic and willingness to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment.
* **Effective Communication:** Possess excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to effectively engage with customers and team members.
* **Adaptability:** Be adaptable and open to change, as the role may require flexibility in tasks and responsibilities.
* **Transportation:** This role will require you to have reliable transportation.

**Compensation:**

**Competitive Base Salary and Healthy Commission-Structure:** Your salary as a Marketing & Lead Generation Specialist will vary based on your level of experience and performance in the role. You will be paid a competitive base salary with weekly commission and a bonus structure designed to incentivize your success to make as much money as possible!

**Performance Bonuses:** We motivate our team by giving back from our own accomplishments and ensure each member benefits from the organizations success.

* **Additional Benefits:** Access to our office gym, mentorship and paid training programs, supportive work environment, and opportunities for career advancement within our growing organization.

If you're a driven individual excited about building a career in marketing and playing a key role in a growing company, we'd love to hear from you. Your efforts in lead generation are vital to our continued success and expansion, and we're ready to invest in your growth as an integral part of our team.

\\*Veterans and students are encouraged to apply.

**Knowledge, Skills and/or Abilities****:**


**Required:**


Normal basic patient care equipment, wheelchairs and stretchers. Good interpersonal and communication skills.

  

  

Location: Hunterdon Healthcare System · Float Nursing  

Schedule: Per Diem, Days/Evenings & Weekends, Monday - Friday and weekends

title: RN
description:
**Position Summary**


Provides quality nursing care through the application of the nursing process using evidence based practice focusing on excellent outcomes and patient experience within the framework of Shared Governance.

  


**Primary Position Responsibilities**


1. Facilitate and Coordinate Total Patient Care


2. Documentation of Care


3. Maintain Professional Development


4. Education of patient and family


5. Patient Advocate


6. Maintain Patient Safety

  


**Qualifications**


**Minimum Education****:**


**Required:**


All hires after July 2012 are required to have a Bachelor's Degree in nursing OR if Associates Degree or Diploma, RN must provide proof of enrollment in a BSN program prior to hire, be continuously enrolled and complete within 5 years of hire date or internal RN promotion date.

  

  

**Minimum Years of Experience (Amount, Type and Variation)****:**


**Required:**


None


**Preferred:**


One year of acute care nursing experience.

  

  

**License, Registry or Certification****:**


**Required:**


Current NJ RN licensure. American Heart Association CPR, ACLS certification.


**Preferred:**


PCCN or related specialty certification.

  

  

**Knowledge, Skills and/or Abilities****:**


**Required:**


Complete Critical Care, Vents and stroke training within one year of hire. Basic arrhythmia Interpretation completed within 6 months of hire.

  

  

Location: Hunterdon Healthcare System · 5 South Unit - Progressive Care Unit  

Schedule: Full-time, Evenings, Nights & Weekends, Sunday through Saturday

title: Patient Care Assistant
description:
**Position Summary**


Provides quality patient care under the direction of a Registered Nurse. Works within the guidelines of established practice for the Patient Care Assistant at HMC. Supports the mission, philosophy, and objectives of Hunterdon Medical Center.

  


**Primary Position Responsibilities**


1. Assistance with total patient care under the direction of the RN


2. Promotes Patient Safety


3. Promotes and supports an organized work environment


4. Other duties as assigned

  


**Qualifications**


**Minimum Education****:**


**Required:**


High School Diploma or Equivalent

  

  

**Minimum Years of Experience (Amount, Type and Variation)****:**


**Required:**


None


**Preferred:**


One year acute care Nursing Assistant experience.

  

  

**License, Registry or Certification****:**


**Required:**


State Certified Nurse Aide (CNA) certification OR non-certified nursing assistant with acute care hospital experience required. CPR certification is required. Crisis Prevention (CPI) training is required, and must be renewed annually. If not certified upon hire, must obtain certification within 6 months. CPI Course will be provided at Hunterdon.

  

  

**Knowledge, Skills and/or Abilities****:**


**Required:**


Normal knowledge of basic patient care equipment, wheelchairs, and stretchers. Good interpersonal and communication skills.

  

  

Location: Hunterdon Healthcare System · 3 West Unit - Medical/Surgical  

Schedule: Full-time, Evening/Nights, Sun-Sat 6:45 PM-7:15 AM, weekend rotation required, alternating holidays

title: Manager Patient Flow
description:
**Position Summary**


Serves as the primary patient flow coordinator for managing daily patient throughput. The primary goals of this position is to improve hospital throughput of ED admissions, Direct Admissions, Surgical Admissions, increase inpatient bed utilization and reduce patient and bed turnaround delays while working in collaboration with the clinical staff. Provides overall direction for and coordination of throughput in real time. Communicates continuously through the shift to ensure all hospital units and departments align with the plan and goal of timely patient movement. Creates an environment that adapts to regulatory and practice changes. Personal goals,  

objectives and behaviors demonstrate an understanding and commitment to continuous improvement opportunities.


**Primary Position Responsibilities**


* Oversight of Central Transport staffing and operations. Including budget, staffing, interviewing and onboarding of new hires. Ensuring Central Transport undertakes transporting of patients in a safe and efficient manner in accordance with approved policies and procedures.


* Serves as the primary contact for all bed requests and bed assignment housewide. Facilitates movement of patients to drive the organizational goals of timely patient placement and discharges/transfers.


* Collaborates with Nursing Supervisor, Nurse Directors, and staffing office to discuss staffing needs when appropriate to ensure effective and appropriate staffing based on census .Provides direction to Admitting, EVS Team, Nursing Depts and Emergency to prioritize and determine appropriate placement of patients.


* Develops, recommends and implements process and procedure improvements/changes to enhance effectiveness and efficiency


* Serves as a patient advocate by assuring care rendered is appropriate, timely and confidential


* Reports patient flow data; assists with developing and managing action plans.


* Coordinates and Collaborates patient flow meetings maintaining interdisciplinary approach to improve efficiencies and work through barriers
  




**Qualifications**


**Minimum Education****:**


**Required:**


High School Diploma or equivalent. Basic professional knowledge. Experience working in the hospital clinical setting. (RN, UC, PCA, RT, LPN etc)


**Preferred:**


Graduate of an accredited school of nursing preferred or 3-5 years of working in a clinical/hospital setting.

  

  

**Minimum Years of Experience (Amount, Type and Variation)****:**


**Required:**


none


**Preferred:**


3-5 years working in a hospital/clinical setting

  

  

**License, Registry or Certification****:**


**Required:**


none


**Preferred:**


RN

  

  

**Knowledge, Skills and/or Abilities****:**


**Required:**


Excellent communication skills. Must be able to critically think in a fast paced environment. Medical terminology knowledge and computer skills are required


**Preferred:**


Previous experience in a bed flow management position.

  

  

Location: Hunterdon Healthcare System · Central Transport  

Schedule: Full-time, Days/Evenings, Monday - Friday 11:00 -7:30pm with occasional weekend shifts as needed

title: Patient Care Technician
description:
**Position Summary**


Performs patient care assistant responsibilities for patients as part of the nursing team. Performs collection of blood specimens and records electrical impulses of the heart as ordered by a physician. Assists with general office/clerical functions on nursing units.

  


**Primary Position Responsibilities**


1. Assistance with total patient care under the direction of the RN


2. Promotes Patient Safety


3. Promotes and supports an organized work environment


4. Preforms collection of blood specimens and EKG’s as ordered by the physician


5. Preforms general office/clerical functions on the nursing units


6. Other Duties as assigned

  


**Qualifications**


**Minimum Education****:**


**Required:**


High school diploma or equivalent.

  

  

**Minimum Years of Experience (Amount, Type and Variation)****:**


**Required:**


Previous hospital experience as a nursing assistant, EMT or physician office patient care experience.


**Preferred:**


Phlebotomy experience preferred.

  

  

**License, Registry or Certification****:**


**Required:**


Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) required, prior experience as a nursing assistant in an acute care setting or EMT experience required. CPR certification is required. Crisis prevention Training (CPI) is required and must be renewed annually. If not certified upon hire must obtain certification within 6 months. CPI Course will be provided by Hunterdon.

  

  

**Knowledge, Skills and/or Abilities****:**


**Required:**


Normal basic patient care equipment, wheelchairs and stretchers. Good interpersonal and communication skills.

  

  

Location: Hunterdon Healthcare System · Emergency Room  

Schedule: Full-time, Days/Evenings & Weekends, 8a-8p including every other weekend

title: FP&A Analyst
description:
At Summit Facility Solutions, we pride ourselves on being a comprehensive, one-stop solution for all our clients facility management needs. Our expertise spans janitorial services, maintenance, pest management, and landscaping, ensuring that every aspect of our clients facilities is impeccably maintained.

We are ruthlessly committed to delivering high-quality, reliable services that enable our clients to focus on their core business operations. Our team is dedicated to upholding the highest standards of cleanliness, safety, and aesthetics, creating environments that are both functional and welcoming. Join us and be part of a company that values excellence, innovation, and customer satisfaction.

INC5000 Recipient No. 1740 (2024), No. 449 (2023), No. 85 (2022)

INC5000 Regionals Recipient No. 78 (2024), No. 28 (2023), No. 6 (2022)

Check us out on Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/summitfacilitysolutions

Summit Facility Solutions is a 3 time award winning INC5000 Company, headquartered in Holmdel NJ. We are a full service facilities provider, offering a one-stop solutions for our clients across the United States and Canada.

The FP&A Analyst will play a critical role in supporting the financial planning and performance management of Summit Facility Solutions. This position is responsible for developing financial models, managing job costing, analyzing key performance indicators, preparing forecasts, and providing actionable insights to support strategic business decisions.

The ideal candidate is highly analytical, detail-oriented, and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Support the preparation of annual budgets, quarterly forecasts, and long-term financial plans
* Analyze financial performance and provide variance analysis to identify trends, risks, and opportunities
* Develop and maintain financial models to support business planning and decision-making
* Collaborate with department leaders to understand business drivers and financial impacts of operational decisions
* Prepare financial reports, dashboards, and presentations for senior management
* Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide insights to drive operational efficiency and profitability
* Conduct ad hoc financial analysis to support business initiatives, such as new projects, investments, and market expansions
* Assist in the preparation of board presentations and other executive-level reports
* Ensure data accuracy and integrity in financial reporting and analysis
* Participate in process improvement initiatives to enhance the efficiency of the FP&A function

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field
* 5+ years of experience in financial planning & analysis, preferably within the facility management or service industry
* Strong proficiency in financial modeling, forecasting, and analysis tools (Excel, Power BI, or similar software)
* Experience with ERP systems and financial reporting software (e.g., Winetam) is a plus
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail
* Ability to communicate financial information clearly to principal owner
* Ability to manage multiple projects, meet deadlines, and work collaboratively across departments
* High level of integrity and discretion with sensitive financial data

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $85,000.00 - $105,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Physical Setting:

* Office

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* FP&A: 5 years (Required)

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Holmdel, NJ 07733 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: NJ Resident Care Aide / HHA – Part-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking compassionate and dedicated **Resident Care Assistants/Home Health Aides** with a skillset and a heart for helping residents make the most of each day. In this position, you'll be a friendly and familiar face to our residents, providing hands-on care in a respectful and dignified manner. Your role is essential to the care and safety of residents who choose to call The Bristal home. The loving care you bring to the services you provide is fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Additional responsibilities include:

* Assisting residents manage Activities of Daily Living (ADLs)
* Escorting residents to meals and recreational activities
* Supporting residents in achieving their highest level of physical, emotional and psycho-social well-being
* Helping out as needed in the Wellness area to ensure the safety, comfort and wellbeing of our residents
* Following all policies and procedures, and adhering to the instructions of the Nurse Shift Supervisor and the Director of Wellness

**Qualifications:**

* NJ-Certified Nursing Assistant or Home Health Aide
* Experience assisting those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia is a plus
* Must be able to speak and read in English
* Previous experience with geriatric population preferred, providing assistance with ADLs
* Ability to follow instructions and establish personal care routines
* Basic understanding of dementia; patience and professionalism in redirecting residents
* Ability to adjust to different personality types and situations in positive ways
* Must always be reliable, caring and gentle in touch and demeanor
* Maintain an abiding respect for the elderly and remain calm at all times
company_description: The Bristal Assisted Living is the premier in senior living with 24 locations throughout the tri-state area inlcuding Long Island, Westchester, Manhattan, and New Jersey.

title: Porter – Part-Time
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


As a luxury assisted living community, we operate much like a high-end hotel. And that means delivering the ultimate experience in guest services and hospitality every day and in every way. We are seeking an experienced, responsible and well-mannered **Porter** to create and maintain a clean, comfortable and safe environment for our residents throughout our community. You will be required to maintain the cleanliness and orderliness of our busy common areas, including bathrooms, function rooms, stairways, hallways, the parking lot, sidewalks, windows, carpets, floors and all other public areas, as required. You will often come into contact with residents, resident families, other guests and team members, and we expect you to maintain a friendly, courteous and positive attitude at all times, so that these encounters are always pleasant and professional. In this role you will be cleaning assigned common areas of the community in accordance with the guidelines established by the Director of Housekeeping and will assist the Director when and where needed. Special cleaning projects and assistance with snow removal as necessary may be required. The loving care, attention to detail and great customer service you bring to your responsibilities as a Porter are fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* An upbeat, friendly, pleasant and courteous demeanor when dealing with peers, supervisors, guests, residents and management
* Must be consistent, reliable and thorough with all cleaning practices
* Must excel in providing cleaning services in a fast-paced environment
* Experience providing cleaning services in the restaurant, healthcare, hospital, hotel, hospitality or similar industry is a plus
* Prior experience working with a senior population is preferred
* Must be able to communicate in English

**New Jersey locations: Must have or be willing to get a COVID-19 vaccine, subject to legal accommodations**

title: Reflections Care Aide/HHA (Alzheimer's/Dementia Area) – Per Diem
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking a creative, compassionate, hands-on **Recreation Activities Assistant** to assist in presenting and coordinating recreational programs for our assisted living residents, as well as residents with Alzheimer's disease or dementia in our dedicated Reflections Memory Care Neighborhood. You will assist residents in making the adjustment to a new concept of living at our luxury assisted living community, not only encouraging them to continue pursuing their interests, hobbies and lifestyle activities, but also to develop new and stimulating interests, as well. You will help plan fun and safe trips to suitable destinations, such as art galleries, theaters, music venues, racetracks, sports events as well as religious and cultural programs. You will also help prepare, print and distribute copies of our monthly calendar, newsletters and memos to residents. You will also be expected to perform planned activities in the absence of the Director of Recreation. In this role you will maintain a knowledge of resident backgrounds, hobbies, special interests, and spoken languages, etc., and use this knowledge to encourage resident engagement and participation. The loving attention you bring to the assistance you provide is fundamental to the quality of life and the general wellbeing of our residents every day.


Full Time, Part Time, and Per Diem schedules available


The ideal candidate will have the following skills/qualifications:

* One year's prior experience working with a senior population, and those with Alzheimer's disease and dementia a plus
* At least 6 months of Recreation activity experience (art therapy, music therapy) or event leadership experience, and preferably in assisted living, long-term care or a similar industry setting
* Be outgoing, warm and have a genuine caring personality
* Able to create programs that get residents involved and excited
* Be dependable and able to supervise activities, special events and safe excursions for the residents
* Has creative talents in one or more areas, such as art, music, readings, dance, etc.
* Always maintaining oneself well-groomed and properly attired
* Demonstrates good listening and communication skills and always presents a positive spirit and professional attitude
* Possesses a proven ability to lead classes and other instructional learning sessions and speak in front of a group setting with ease, confidence and clarity
* Holds a high school diploma or equivalent at a minimum

**Must have or be willing to get a COVID-19 vaccine, subject to legal accommodations**
